meanings.definition: The act of emitting or reflecting light in a hazy manner.
meanings.sent1: The halations from the streetlights created a dreamy atmosphere in the park.
meanings.sent2: The photographer captured the halations of the sunset beautifully in the picture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to chase the halations bouncing off the disco ball.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, creating halations of joy that enveloped everyone.
meanings.sent5: The halations of the fireflies in the night sky were like tiny stars coming to life.

meanings.definition: A blurred effect in a photograph caused by light scattering within the camera lens.
meanings.sent1: The old camera sometimes produced unexpected halations in the photos.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the settings to reduce the halations in the image.
meanings.sent3: The halations in the picture made it look like a painting rather than a photograph.
meanings.sent4: Her tears blurred the world around her, creating halations of sorrow in every frame.
meanings.sent5: The halations in the photo gave it a mystical quality, as if taken in a different realm.

meanings.definition: The spreading of light beyond its proper boundaries in a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The halations around the streetlamp made the night scene look magical.
meanings.sent2: The photographer used a special filter to control the halations in the image.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous halations seemed to dance around the edges of the photograph.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, causing halations of warmth to fill the space.
meanings.sent5: The halations in the picture gave it an ethereal quality, like a scene from a fairy tale.
